intro: Heliotropium rudbaricum, commonly known as the desert heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a low-growing herb with succulent stems and leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming throughout the growing season. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight. Heliotropium rudbaricum is well adapted to dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitats.
